38749243.review:
It really comes as no surprise to me that the first game from a development team helmed by a former major game designer of the recent 2d Rayman games happens to be one of the best platformer games I have played in recent years.
You really can tell that this game was made by people who truly understand the strengths of the genre and who have been at it for a long time. 

It manages to capture that sweet game flow spot, where you can blaze through a level without having to stop a single time or having to wait for an obstacle to move out of the way (If you are good enough at the game, that is).
Level design is at it's finest here, conveying to you just the enough amount of information about the situation ahead of you without wasting your time or being condescending about it. 
If you have played games like Rayman Legends, Super Meat Boy or Dustforce, then you know exactly what you are getting yourself into here.   

In Splasher you control a janitor who is trying to escape a chemical facility that is using it's workers as lab rats, while saving as many other co-workers as you can. 
At your disposal, you have access to 3 types of projectile fluids that change the way you interact with the environment around you: one that makes you stick to walls and ceilings, one that makes bounce off any surface you touch, and water that clears those two other fluids.
Other than the fluid gimmick, the only other thing you do in this game is jumping.
And that's where the brilliance of the game resides in. It's such a simple game to understand and play, but the real challenge is in how you chain those various fluids to reach the finish line.
Every level brings up some sort of new gimmick or obstacle to overcome and goes wild with it. For example, there is a level where blue lasers kill you if you stay on them for more than a few seconds, and another level where there is a constant wind current dragging you forward. 
But the basic gameplay always remains the same: you can jump and shoot the fluids. The level throws every possible situation at you using it's main gimmick, but you will be doing the same you have always done before.
And its not like you get all the 3 fluids in one go. The game very smartly introduces one fluid at a time and gives you enough levels to get accustomed to it before giving you a new one.

If I had to place it's difficulty somewhere, I would say it is probably harder than the Rayman games, but easier than Super Meat Boy and Dustforce.
I personally found it a breeze to get through, finishing the game with 100% workers saved in 5 hours only. But i have been playing games like this since I was a kid, so this all becomes subjective.
All I can say is that the game has the perfect pacing and ramps up the difficulty very well, the first level being a simple game about jumping over some platforms and the final level being a thrilling escape scene where you are scrambling the controller to use the right fluid at the right time.

If there is a negative point I can throw at the game, it's definitely the art direction and aestethic.
I have nothing against the drawing style used in this game, but it has a severe lack of background diversity and lack of personality and humour.
Every single level has the same setting and background art utilized (and if it does change, its really not noticeable), and the premise of the factory is never really used to it's fullest potential. The factory is turning it's workers into potatoes, but they never do much with that joke, outside of some bland and uninteresting enemies to deal with.
I'm fully aware that story and visuals are not the main appeal of this kind of game, but it goes a long way in making more people interested in the genre and giving your game some sort of personality. I think everyone would agree with me that Rayman Legends without it's art direction, Super Meat Boy without it's charm and humour, and Dustforce without it's background variety and unique soundtrack, would make them lesser games.   
 
But I understand that for a first endeavour, they decided to focus on the stuff that really matters: the gameplay. And in my opinion they created one of the most underrated games of 2017. Im really hopeful of this team's next project.

38137106.review:
[i]아직 게임을 클리어하지 않은 상태에서 작성한 리뷰입니다. 게임의 진행에 따라 평가와 다른 부분이 등장할 수 있습니다.[/i]
[b]부정적인 이유는 후반에 나옵니다. 꼭 끝까지 읽어주세요![/b]


다이렉트게임즈에서 추석 기념으로 세일할 때 [strike]트레일러가 이쁘고 할인율이 높아서[/strike] 구매했던 게임인데, 들어본 적이 없는 인디게임이라 기대하진 않았지만 생각보다 괜찮았습니다. 트레일러를 보면 알겠지만, 2가지의 잉크와 물을 적재적소에 벽이나 적에게 뿌려 스테이지를 클리어하는 게임입니다.

[list]
[*][b]물[/b]은 잉크를 지우고 적에게 직접 공격을 합니다. 물론 잉크를 지울 수 없는 벽과 공격이 통하지 않는 적도 있습니다.
[*][b]빨간 잉크[/b]는 벽과 천장에서는 기본속도보다 살짝 빠르게 이동할 수 있게 해주지만 바닥에서는 느리게 만들고, 적들을 묶어두는 역할을 합니다. 바닥에 뿌릴 경우 슬로우 효과만 적용되지만, 벽이나 직접 잉크를 쏘는 경우는 아예 행동불능과 같은 상태가 됩니다.
[*][b]노란 잉크[/b]는 플레이어와 적들을 튕겨내는 역할을 합니다. 이 잉크에 관해서는 제가 직접 얻은게 아니라 스테이지와 트레일러를 보고 유추한거라 자세하게는 말씀드릴 수 없네요.
[/list]

3개를 처음부터 모두 쓸 수는 없고, 게임이 진행되며 얻을 수 있습니다. 그리고 이들을 "적재적소"에 쓰는 것이, 즉 트레일러마냥 잉크를 갖고 노는 것이 생각보다 어렵습니다. 페인트의 발사 방향을 정하는 키는 이동키와 공유하기 때문에, [b]캐릭터가 움직이면서 쏘는 경우가 많기 때문에[/b] 더더욱 어렵습니다. 컵헤드에서 락(lock) 없이 조준하는 것과 매커니즘이 거의 동일하다고 보시면 됩니다. 다행히 잉크의 속도가 매우 빠른 편이며, 에임 보정이 들어가긴 하기 때문에 못할 정도는 아닙니다.


+ 눈이 즐겁습니다. 카툰풍의 캐릭터와 적들, 알록달록한 배경과 잉크들이 트레일러에서 볼 수 있듯 꽤 괜찮은 장면을 연출합니다. [strike]캐릭터 인형이나 쓰고있는 후드 갖고싶어요[/strike]

+ 간단하면서 꽤 난이도가 있습니다. 플레이어가 할 수 있는 것은 캐릭터를 움직이는 것과 물 또는 2개의 잉크 중 하나를 쏘는 것인데, 아주 정확한 컨트롤을 요구하는 것은 아니지만 손이 쉽게 꼬입니다. 그래서 쉽게 디자인된 맵인데 다른 잉크들을 교차해서 사용해야한다는 것 때문에 클리어하기는 어려운 경우도 있습니다. 유일한 위안이 되는 것이라면, 잉크와 상호작용하는 오브젝트는 잉크의 종류를 따지지 않는다는 겁니다.


- [b]옵션이 불친절합니다.[/b] 별거 아닌 것 같지만 매우 중요한, 게임은 괜찮음에도 가끔 접고싶게 만드는 요인입니다. 옵션에 단 6개의 요소밖에 없습니다.
[list]
[*] 음향 (배경음, 효과음)
[*] 디스플레이 모니터 설정
[*] 해상도 설정
[*] 그래픽 필터
[*] 전체화면
[*] WASD키 활성화/비활성화
[/list]
여기서 중요한 것은 맨 마지막 옵션인데, 저 옵션도 전체 옵션의 구석에 덤으로 있는데다 결정적으로 [b]저 옵션을 제외하면 조작키와 관련된 설정이 전혀 없습니다.[/b] 심지어 WASD를 활성화시켜도 기존의 방향키 입력이 무시되는 것이 아니기 때문에, 조작키를 바꾸는 옵션이 전혀 없는 것과 같습니다. 버그인진 모르겠지만 WASD 옵션을 꺼도 WASD가 입력이 되네요. 이와 관련된 말은 잠시 뒤에 계속 하겠습니다.

- 한글화가 조금 안좋게 되었습니다. 음향 옵션에 배경음, 효과음이 아니라 실제로는 배경, 음향 효과(Background와 SFX를 직역한)으로 적혀있는데다, 스테이지 명도 다소 이해하기 힘든 것도 있었고, 가장 큰 문제는 [b]굴림체입니다.[/b] 그런데 옵션에서는 언어 변경도 불가능합니다. 지금까지 플레이한 바로는 텍스트가 그리 중요하지 않은 게임인데 이렇게 한글화를 할거면 그냥 냅뒀으면 어땠나 생각이 드네요..

- [b]조작키가 정말 이상하게 배치되어 있습니다.[/b] 농담이 아닙니다. 일단 이동은 방향키인데 점프가 K입니다. (?) 물을 쏘는 것은 J인데 두 잉크를 쏘는 키는 L. ;입니다. (??) 옵션키가 있긴 한데 그게 WASD에 점프용 스페이스바입니다. 근데 점프를 스페이스바로 하면 3가지 액체를 쏘는 키가 J, L, ;가 되어 키 1개를 건너뛰게 됩니다. (???) 기본키를 쓰자니 키보드의 왼쪽에 손이 너무 모아지고, 옵션키를 쓰자니 3가지 중 하나를 고르는 키의 배치가 매우 이상하게 됩니다. 익숙해지면 된다지만, [b]전 아직도 제작자가 왜 점프를 K에 배치했는지 1도 모르겠습니다.[/b] 가뜩이나 발사용 키 3개가 붙어있어도 헷갈려서 죽을 판인데, 물을 쏘기 위해 검지를 눌렀는데 K가 눌려서 점프가 되어 죽을 때의 느낌이란.. 그 와중에 키 세팅 옵션이 전혀 없습니다. 개발자가 키세팅 관련 질문에 "키세팅 바꾸는 기능은 없지만, 추후 업데이트로 추가하겠습니다"라고 말은 했는데, 그게 2017년 5월임에도 불구하고 지금까지 나오지 않은 것을 봐서는 답이 없어보입니다. [strike]이거 하나 때문에 게임을 하고 싶어도 하기 싫어집니다.[/strike]

- 저사양 컴퓨터에서는 프레임 드랍이 일어납니다. 제 노트북에서는 그래픽 필터를 꺼도 렉이 걸리더군요. 물론 게이밍 노트북이 아닌 탓도 있습니다만.

37930019.review:
Splasher est un jeu de plateforme 2D avec une touche de "Die and Retry" très soft et de nombreuses références aux jeux Oddworld de Oddworld Entertainment. Il a été réalisé par le studio indépendant français Splashteam et édité par The Sidekicks en 2017. 
Le but du jeu est de franchir de nombreux niveaux en ayant la peinture nécessaire tout en sauvant vos semblables des griffes du patron de votre entreprise depuis que vous avez apprit qu'il faisait des expériences sur eux. Pour cela vous possédez un pistolet pouvant tirer : - de l'eau ce qui inflige des dégâts à certains ennemis et enlever la peinture, 
- de la peinture collante (rose) pour s'aggriper aux murs ou au plafond. Si vous tirez sur un ennemi il ne pourra plus bouger et si vous tirez au sol, elle vous ralentira,
- de la peinture élastique (jaune) avec laquelle vous pouvez faire de grands sauts.

Pourquoi je le recommande? Tout simplement pour son gameplay qui est frais, très frais. Ce jeu n'est pas un plateformer classique où on nous propose de fracasser tout ce qui bouge mais du mouvement et de la technique. Il y a de nombreux éléments de gameplay que je n'ai pas dit mais leur réalisation par rapport aux mécaniques font que le level-design est très propre et que rien est inutile. La bande-son tout comme les graphismes sont bien sûr tout aussi intéressant. Le seul point légèrement dommage mais sans plus est le scénario peu riche.
Dès que vous pouvez, proccurez-le vous.

37867405.review:
Splasher est avant tout un plateformer 2D d'exception. Issu de la SplashTeam, studio français basé sur Montpellier, ce jeu est séparé en 3 temps :

Premièrement, vous apprennez rapidement les controles dans les premiers niveaux, puis vous aurez accès à l'eau, la "peinture bleue" qui vous servira à activer certains mécanismes, effacer de la peinture rouge ou jaune et même arroser vos plantes !

Ensuite vous débloquerez la peinture rouge, une peinture très efficace puisqu'elle vous permet de vous accrocher aux murs, au plafond, d'immobiliser les ennemis pour les rendres pacifiques ou même, si vous le souhaitez, repeindre les murs de votre salon

Finalement, la peinture chaotique, j'ai nommé la peinture jaune. Cette peinture qui ressemble à du fromage fondu lorsqu'elle est bien étalée, vous permet de rebondir avec un force qui dépasse l'entendement, en ayant pour base le sol, les murs ou le plafond. Vous pourrez également vous en servir pour repousser les ennemis. Attention cependant à ne pas en mettre sur vos pâtes !

Ces trois peintures sont à associer si vous souhaitez vous en sortir dans ce jeu.
Dans chaque niveau (il y en a 22) vous devrez sauver 6 splashers et récupérer 700 points gouttes pour obtenir le splasher d'or, ils sont nécessaires pour avancer dans le jeu. Attention à ne pas les tuer non plus, c'est vite arrivé !
Certains splashers sont dans des warp zones qui peuvent faire penser à des puzzles, très sympa !

Niveau temps de jeu, j'ai personnelement terminé le jeu en Any% au bout de 5h environ
Si vous avez l'âme d'un speedrunner, ce jeu est fait pour vous car il intègre la possibilité de speedrunner les niveaux en time attack, ou même de speedrunner le jeu que ce soit en Any% ou en 100%

Mon seul bémol serait au niveau des succès, j'aurai aimer faire ce jeu à 100% mais pas mal de succès nous obligent de faire les modes speedrun avec des bons temps, ce qui n'est pas accessible à tout le monde, dommage !

J'ai pas envie de finir sur un truc négatif, ce jeu est bien.

36084265.review:
Splasher est le mélange improbable entre Super Meat Boy et les fluides de Portal 2. Un bouton, un fluide, une couleur, un effet. 
Le jeu est mignon, la progression bien dosée avec une difficulté suffisante pour ne pas décourager le premier joueur venu. Le jeu est lisible, agréable à l'œil et le gameplay répond parfaitement. 
En ligne droite sans chercher à récupérer les personnages disséminés dans les niveaux, je dirais qu'il faut 6 heures pour le finir. Et une à deux heures de plus dans le cas contraire. De plus, le jeu étant clairement pensé pour permettre le speedrun, la durée de vie peut devenir monstrueuse. Sachant que les développeurs ont prévu deux types de speedrun et un mode attrapez les tous. De quoi assouvir sa soif de Splasher.

Alors, quels sont les défauts de ce plateformer qui a l'air fort réussi ?

Tout d'abord, la maniabilité bien que réussie est assez perturbante puisque la direction du tir est sur le stick gauche, ce qui peut être très perturbant voire rageant dans certaines situations qui demandent de la précision.
Ensuite, le jeu manque clairement de folie dans ses niveaux. C'est monotone (justifié par le fait que l'on soit dans une usine), même s'il y a quelques idées (le train beaucoup trop court). Personnellement, ça manque un peu de passages qui poussent le délire du jeu. Parce que combattre un docteur Maboul qui se sert des patates comme chair à canon, ça mérite le détour.
Enfin, il y a un côté très mécanique qui se met en place quand on parcourt les niveaux. C'est peut être moi, mais j'ai l'impression que le jeu ne cherche jamais vraiment à sortir de sa zone de confort et encore moins de chercher à surprendre le joueur.

En résumé, c'est un jeu de plateformes efficace qui a un gameplay maîtrisé malgré des passages qui en montrent les limites (peu nombreux). C'est mignon, parfaitement calibré pour le speedrun. Dommage qu'il soit trop convenu, ce qui l'empêche d'accéder à un niveau supérieur. 
Un bon jeu, un bon moment sans être mémorable.
 
P.S. : Le hub qui oblige à utiliser les fluides pour atteindre les niveaux suivants est une très bonne idée sans être lourdingue.

33965866.review:
[h1]首先感谢奶牛关野蔷薇平台和Splasher作者提供的key[/h1]
图文版评测请移步[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Splasher/review/2600698]奶牛关原文[/url]

玩Portal时，我曾不止一次想过：要是能随身携带白色胶、弹力胶和滑行胶的话，岂不是上天入地飞檐走壁无所不能？Splasher满足了我所有的幻想。游戏机制非常简单，共有三种喷剂——水、红喷漆、黄喷漆。水能洗喷漆、杀死薄甲敌人、触发机关；红喷漆具有粘性，能让自己爬上墙和天花板，也能限制敌人的行动；黄喷漆具有弹性，能让自己跳得高弹得远，对着敌人射可以产生几万牛的作用力。这三种“武器”结合起来用，威力无穷。

通常来说，speedrun主题的platformer都有较高的门槛。[b]然而Splasher却极其好上手，这主要得益于它的关卡设计，与其说它是门槛低的硬核platformer，倒不如说它是『极具深度』的休闲platformer。[/b]

Splasher虽然没有教学关，但它在中早期关卡不断地对玩家进行正面引导和教学，这胜过了一切。难度曲线是那么的平缓，新机制的引入是那么的自然。Splasher加入收集要素放缓了游戏的节奏，在全收集的过程中，玩家的水平会大大提高，为speedrun打下了基础。每一关都有4+2+1名工人可以解救，前4名可以理解为普通的收集要素，中间2名需要去“隔离区”救。隔离区其实就是一个小型竞技场，在平台跳跃中加入了战斗的元素，你需要利用地形、喷剂和机关从中突围。解救最后一名工人需要700点燃料，而一整关通过杀敌、救工人、“洗墙”能获得的总燃料也就700出头，这意味着你得几乎全清整个地图。

看到这，玩过雷曼的盆友可能会觉得Splasher的收集形式有点似曾相识，实际上Splasher正是由雷曼的关卡设计师和《勇敢的心》的音效师共同制作的，关卡名称玩了很多梗，我把自己能认出来的列举出来吧。

7 - There Will Be Fries [spoiler]There Will Be Blood[/spoiler]
8 - Ray Man Origin
10 - Ink In Park [spoiler]Linkin Park[/spoiler]
12 - Troopers Please
13 - Water is coming
15 - Big Bounce Theory [spoiler]这不是柳丁脚踏车[/spoiler]
18 - Ray Man Legend
19 - Toxink Avenger [spoiler]Toxic Avenger[/spoiler]
20 - The Glados Principle

Splasher的商店页面有“Controller”这个标签。事实上，键盘只能朝八个方向喷射，而手柄有双摇杆可以实现360度无死角喷射。更重要的是，键盘的喷射方向受到人物移动方向限制，换句话说，人物往右走时没法朝左边射、往上爬墙时没法朝下射。但是自动瞄准拯救了世界，键盘用起来没有那么不堪，我这种手柄苦手肯定是会坚持用键盘的。键位是我最适应的，同时也是我认为最合理的——WASD移动，K跳跃，J、L、I分别对应水、红喷漆、黄喷漆。因为黄喷漆经常会代替跳跃，所以放在和K没那么兼容的位置上。然而设定里不能改键位还是让我费解，又不是什么多难实现的功能，为什么就不能体贴一点呢？

刚接触Splasher时觉得手感很滑，但我适应后反而很迷恋这种感觉，毕竟玩speedrun需要一定的惯性。适应这种手感的方法很简单：尽量少转身，用大跳和小跳控制自己的节奏，玩过BIT.TRIP.RUNNER系列应该能理解。

那么问题就来了，为什么说Splasher『极具深度』呢？因为想玩好实在是太难了。首先，游戏难度在获得黄喷漆后陡增，三种喷剂容易搞混。黄喷漆的使用也不容易精通——在地面上按“下”再喷才能把自己弹起，爬左边的墙时要按“左”再喷才能把自己往右弹。更重要的是，Splasher有关卡计时模式（Time Attack），有白金、黄金、白银和青铜四个奖牌——黄金时间是白金时间加10秒取整、白银时间是黄金时间加10秒、青铜时间是白银时间加15秒。白金奖牌之所以这么难，是因为这个时间是高手测试出来的，他走了所有高难度捷径，细节也做得不错。想要赢，只能和他一样，走所有高难度捷径，并把细节做得更好，难度可想而知。

还有三个Speedrun全游戏的模式：Selfish、Standard和Gotta Catch'em All，同样设有四种奖牌供高玩进行挑战。Selfish顾名思义，就是只管自己，每一关冲到终点即可。Standard要求玩家解救80名工人，80这个数字就特别精妙了，还记得每一关总共有4+2+1名工人吗？Splasher总共22关，这意味着Standard模式无须去隔离区救工人，常规路线上最难救的几名工人也可以战术放弃。Gotta Catch'em All则要求全收集。



最后说一下Splasher的不足吧。
游戏内容存在断层。总共22关，游戏在第14关获得黄喷漆之前没什么挑战性。大多数玩家通关即是全收集，耗时仅仅在5-10小时不等，内容不够充实。随后的进一步挑战便是高难度、零容错还考验细节的Time Attack和Speedrun了，绝大多数玩家在这里就弃坑了。以我之见，像Shovel Knight那样加一个NG+就非常完美了——少一些存盘点、多一些机关和敌人，玩家从一开始就拥有三种喷剂算是一种平衡吧。

剧情直白中二，虽然我玩platformer不太重视剧情，但这还是远远低于我的预期。进行人体实验的邪恶公司，居然被一个天赋异禀的普通员工给一锅端了。

Mac版的优化不够好，我高配15寸MBP 2016开着录像软件玩经常掉帧，有时还直接造成了我的死亡，很影响游戏体验。



[h1]总之，Splasher是一款优秀的platformer, 兼顾了休闲玩家和硬核玩家的游戏体验。但它的缺点也很明显：过分依赖Time Attack和Speedrun撑起略显单薄的游戏内容，自然不会对所有玩家的胃口。[/h1]

33668824.review:
[code]感谢奶牛关野蔷薇平台与轻语汉化组提供的key，本文为游戏评价与对比[/code]

《喷射侠》 Splasher是一款平台跳跃游戏，和大多数同类型游戏不同的是，Splasher大多依靠角色本身的能力，而不是已存在的平台与机关。游戏中，玩家作为喷漆公司中的职员，在发现了顶层boss的邪恶秘密后，开启喷漆逃亡的行动。

作为一款平台跳跃游戏，舒服的手感，合理有趣的关卡设计以及创新都很重要，《喷射侠》这三点兼顾，唯独缺少有趣的剧情与关卡之间的衔接。就拿之前热议的《汐》作比较，shio的剧情很长也发人生思，隐藏剧情的穿插令整个游戏连贯又统一，玩下去就是通关整个游戏。《喷射侠》在连贯与剧情方面就很薄弱了，极短浅薄的剧情加上关卡制的游戏设定，让整个游戏显得支离破碎，如果一段时间不玩，可能就沦为传家宝，放着落灰了。

这是《喷射侠》中我所能找到的唯一缺点，但也就因此虽然评价不错，游戏的销量却不是很佳。游戏以2D的视角，动画的形式展开，简单的颜色搭配，构成了明亮清晰的游戏画面，可惜达不到惊艳的水平，与游戏中的音效一样，仅仅是合格的水准，几天没玩后，我已经忘记了游戏中的音乐。

值得称赞的是操作的手感，不飘也不重，但这仅限于手柄操作。第一次玩《喷射侠》的时候就被游戏的手感惊艳到了，之前玩shio的时候总会莫名地飘或者是跳的时候不好控制高度等，本作则不存在这种几率性的事件，如果玩的多了，每一关都可以非常华丽顺畅的过关，玩起来看起来都非常的爽，这种爽快一是靠游戏本身的手感，其次就是靠游戏创新有趣的玩法与多种游戏模式了。
[list]
 [*]喷漆：游戏中玩家需要借助3种颜色喷漆过关与收集，红色：可以黏住玩家，达到倒立行走等动作；黄色：触碰即跳跃；水：可以清洗喷漆。借助两种颜色的喷漆，可以探索关卡中 绝大多数的地区，完成收集并过关。在完成特定关卡后，玩家可以喷出红色/黄色两种喷漆与水，在解锁全部能力   后，整个关卡可以说是及其爽快，多种不同的方式可以过关，并不是靠多次练习与及其细节的操作才能过关。这一点比shio人性很多，难度也降低很多，在玩《喷射侠》的时候，我只会在全收集的时候才会用些时间，而过关则仅仅是一种游戏性的体验，简单有趣。

 [*]漩涡：在关卡中存在着黑色的漩涡，漩涡中则是一个类似小游戏的副关卡，借助场景中的锯齿毒液等击杀机械兵，可以解救工友，完成收集。

 [*]收集：《喷射侠》中收集应该说是主体了，游戏中的收集其实是拯救工友。每一关中都有7名工友等待救援，前六个是在关卡中存在的，第七个则需要收集700燃料进行拯救，可以说收集是我进行游戏的最大动力了。

 [*]跑酷模式：除了基础的过关收集模式，游戏中还存在跑酷模式，在最短的时间通过关卡，这个模式不是我的菜，所以就玩了一次。
[/list]
总体来说，《喷射侠》是一款合格的平台跳跃游戏，操作手感很棒，关卡设计优秀，但碍于深度不够，不能称作神作，玩一玩尚可，但体验没多久，那份新鲜感就不在了，也就沦为一款一款尚可的佳作，对我而言，《汐》更好玩，不仅限于其深刻的剧情，还包括中式的游戏风格与精彩的音效。本作则少了这些华丽的包装，玩起来像是一款小游戏，这也就是游戏销量不佳的原因吧。

33503620.review:
一个喷子的自我修养
——简评《Splasher》

此游戏的key自奶牛关社区的野蔷薇计划获得，感谢开发者与相关社区工作人员的努力。

太长不看的简评：
+精巧的关卡设计
+细致的Comic美术风格画面
+与游戏节奏应和的背景音乐
+多样的游戏机制
-老套的剧情
-键位设置不合理

总评：7.3/10，完成度很高的横版平台跳跃游戏，值得入手。

之前和轻语的朋友出展时，曾经试玩了一下这个游戏，当时的想法是这游戏有点难度，但看着其他玩家轻松过关，便产生了我能平推这游戏的错觉。在奶牛关这边入手Key后，我便同家里晚辈吹嘘自己玩的特别强，然后在欢声笑语间打出GG，被各种鄙视...

言归正传，在Steam上发行的横版平台类游戏大概有一千四百个，制作简单、机制成熟，开发者们都爱它。虽然...其中大部分都是无意义的、强行拼凑起来的信息垃圾。
我们无需去思考为何横版平台这一传统的游戏分类正在慢慢沦为垃圾场，我们只要知道，哪些游戏令人感兴趣，值不值得玩家花费时间与精力去玩。
《Splasher》便是个引人注目，而又值得一玩的横版平台游戏。
在游戏中，玩家需要操纵的是一个临时工，凭借可以喷出不同功能的油漆的喷枪，跳跃在机关重重的喷漆公司中，拯救同伴、打倒监视者、最后破灭大老板博士的阴谋，剧情非常老套。

但游戏中精巧的关卡设计掩盖了这方面的不足，经验丰富的开发者巧妙地将惯性跑酷和代表弹射、无重力的两种模式的两色喷漆相结合，通过喷水/杀怪触发机关、收集金色油漆来调节游戏节奏，再加上每一关中需要技巧的拯救伙伴任务，将难度曲线几乎削成了一条平整的渐近线。

手残玩家可以靠背板慢慢适应难度变化，硬核高玩则可以在跑酷模式里挑战极限，同时满足了不同玩家群体的需求。

使《Splasher》脱颖而出的，不仅仅是游戏性。
色彩丰富而细节十足的美术设计极好地将游戏的特点体现出来，动感而富有特色的背景音乐则“催促”着玩家不断跳跃前进（虽然玩久了听到BGM就会不自觉绷紧神经准备摔手柄），音画配合，令游戏的整体素质更上一层楼。

当然，游戏中还是存在一定的不足。最重要的一点就是固定的游戏键位难以适应，手柄的移动与设计方向都固定在右摇杆，人为地增加了游戏难度；同时，游戏中的跳过动画按钮时灵时不灵，会给反复刷同一关卡的玩家带来了不少困扰。希望开发者在接下来的更新中给出相应的解决方案。

总体而言，《Splasher》是一部优秀的横版平台游戏，无论是像我一样的手残菜鸡还是追求极限的硬核玩家都能在游戏中找到属于自己的乐趣，来一起做一个快乐的喷子吧！

33499437.review:
尴尬于Steam评测展示机制，如果想查看相对更全的历史中文评测、攻略及视频，可移歩[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Splasher]奶牛关Splasher词条[/url]。

首先感谢[b]奶牛关野蔷薇服务[/b]以及[b]Splasher/喷射侠作者[/b]提供的试玩机会。我玩过一些同类型游戏，但并非此类型游戏的硬核玩家，所以仅以普通玩家的角度简单阐述本作给我的感受，力求客观，希望评测可以对各位玩家及Splasher作者有所启发帮助。

游戏内容基本如商店视频所示：快节奏、跑酷、战斗、背板、喷漆。具体玩法就不说了，易于上手难于精通，下面我主要说说视频中看不出来的特色内容。

[h1]关卡设计与游戏难度[/h1]

喷射侠的关卡设计是围绕着跑酷的速度感与连贯性两方面做文章，但它没有拿跑酷的“酷”来压玩家，游戏整体难度曲线较为合理，曲线上升基于玩家技术的逐步提高。部分评测中所说的“虐手虐心”有些片面，实际前中期的关卡在缓慢加入新挑战要素的同时，给玩家提供了非常充足上手、练习的机会。不过，为强调速度感与连贯性，关卡的节奏较快，不可避免地突出了背板的作用，减少了对玩家快速应变能力的考察。后期游戏难度的来源并非关卡更加复杂精妙，而是频繁要求玩家快速连贯正确操作，这一点上玩家体验见仁见智。

值得一提的是，由于前中期关卡中有大量教学意味的机关、地形设计，玩家很容易获得明确的游戏技巧上的正反馈——如何实现正确操作、不同地形应该使用怎样的技巧，一切呈现得非常清晰，这也是我认为喷射侠最赞的一点。

[h1]操作与手感[/h1]

SMB/肉孩属于一上来就能让玩家感受到硬核气息的游戏，没错，我说的就是手感：诸如加速跑、小跳大跳、平地打滑、弹墙、贴墙下落加速度等等，给玩家的操作蒙上了一层玄学的阴影，而这些压榨操作的设定还与游戏难度直接挂钩，残酷的设计直逼手残玩家心理防线。

喷射侠没有这么复杂难控制的物理元素，同时以特色的“喷漆”降低了普通玩家进阶高玩的门槛。喷漆使用起来简单高效（喷射有辅助瞄准），使角色行动轨迹更加稳定可预见，提高了操作容错率，减少了误操作尬死带来的沮丧感，使整个跑酷过程有趣且不失挑战，让普通玩家也有机会开心刺激地完整体验全部关卡。关卡设计与角色能力的巧妙协调也使得复杂的技巧性操作得以简化，很多肉孩中需要熟练掌握才能顺利完成的动作在本作中可以很容易地使用出来、重复完成，极大地加快了游戏节奏，提升了爽快感。

[h1]“手残友好型”硬核游戏[/h1]

偶然看到另一位玩家评测说到“手残友好型”，非常贴切。喷射侠并没有因为自身拥有硬核要素就往牛角尖上钻，相反它拥有很多帮助非硬核玩家的设定，比如像BBT/战砖一样无限生命、多存档点、可无限挑战且不干扰主线关卡的支线小房间等等。而更重要的是作者还照顾了普通玩家心里的感受：普通主线流程关卡结束时没有评级、没有计时器，没有无形的力量在评判玩家的游戏过程，这真的让游戏过程变得快乐许多。实际上拥有评级、计时器的时间竞赛模式和普通模式合并起来也没问题，但那样带给普通玩家的体验绝对与现在的情况是天壤之别——没有人会希望自己的全流程被强行评价BCD，那样只会使玩家下意识地去重玩老关卡，并在这一过程中无意义地消耗掉游戏热情。是享受轻松刺激，还是追求硬核极限，此时的选择权才真正意义上在玩家手中。

[h1]对于销量平平的猜测[/h1]

抛开外力因素单说游戏本身，我觉得本作缺少引起好奇心、激发探索欲的成分，缺少能把玩家的心牢牢抓住的精妙把戏，或者说，喷射侠整体味道略为寡淡：

1，剧情发展直白。一路追击挑战最后击败BOSS，角色刻画也草草而过，作者没能让自己构架出的游戏世界“活”起来，有点对不起美术和音乐营造的气氛。
2，缺少奖励机制。完全依赖普通模式过关和竞速模式的数据获得满足感。
3，关卡整体的节奏趋平。短短的22关，中间没有“阶段性胜利”的体验，从头到尾像是在完成一大关中的22小关（可实际22关很快就过去了，结局来得很突然）。如果没有游戏进度查看菜单，真的感受不到进度有实质推进。我觉得这方面的欠缺容易让玩家感觉漫长且疲惫，也是对爽快炫酷游戏特色的一种削弱。
4，关卡让人觉得有些空荡。虽然主角跳得高射得远，但在巨大的关卡中，实际体验起来和肉孩、BBT的“小人+小地图”没什么区别（视野反倒不如二者大），可能是因为机关密度不够、地形不够复杂丰富，而这也许是对追求跑酷速度感与连贯性做出的牺牲。
5，通关之后进一步挑战是原有关卡的竞速模式，其挑战点在于压榨容错以及少量的路线规划。个人感觉这个点做得不够好，跟关卡设计应该也有一定关系——关卡给出的可发挥的路线太少，于是游戏内容就只剩下容错了。

有趣的流程，出色的手感，但单纯靠关卡的变化、压榨玩家操作，我觉得不足以维持多数人的热情，最终留存的仍然是硬核玩家。画龙还须点睛，这或许是Splasher的遗憾吧。

[h1]其他需要说明的[/h1]

1，每次开游戏载入时间都谜之漫长，尤其安装游戏后第一次启动，希望有所优化。不过游戏中途无卡顿大可放心。
2，不能改键位，虽说“WSAD”模式的JKL用起来也没什么大问题，但仍然希望加入自定义按键让三种喷射枪在使用时可以更符合个人习惯。
3，汉化文本量虽小但质量不错，略有瑕疵无伤大雅（时间竞赛模式ESC菜单中“新的跑酷”，其实是重新开始当前关卡；自由跑酷模式入口的介绍文字排版错误）。
[u]4，用键盘手感挺好的，并不是肉孩那样键盘操作难度X2。[/u]
5，还有很多精彩的细节设计不一一赘述了，确实感受到了作者对玩家体验的细致思考（比如关卡中的收集要素也就是解救工友，工友自带排序方便玩家知道自己是否有疏漏）。

[h1]总结[/h1]

喷射侠整体给我的感受是：就像雷曼一样，但也像雷曼一样，很简单很纯粹，有褒义也有贬义。
推荐给任何对此类型游戏感兴趣的玩家，毕竟雷曼，值得一试。

再次感谢奶牛关野蔷薇服务及游戏作者。希望这篇评测可以给你帮助。

33480797.review:
https://cowlevel.net/game/Splasher/review/2557533

首先，感谢野蔷薇及开发者给我的这次机会。虽说是个独立游戏，不过听说有着《雷曼传奇》的关卡设计师，《勇敢的心》的音效师，所谓独立游戏中的史诗级制作整容。

开头漫画般的叙事风格就给人一种不错的风格，诡异的工厂，主角的醒悟，虽然可以说是PPT形式的展现，不过依旧给人一种连贯舒适的体验。

本作的上手难度十分简单，两种喷漆，红色用来攀岩，黄色用来跳，水可以洗掉喷漆。不过难度嘛、、、、《雷曼传奇》的关卡设计师我们来聊聊，有没有兴趣转行去宫崎英高那里？后期大部分地方都追求者着一种连贯的操作，而且角色控制需要一定的时间熟悉。

除了关卡外，游戏还有跑酷模式和时间模式，支持全球排名。熟悉地图的大触们可以跑的一个比一个顺畅潇洒，至于萌新和手残党，估计死字都不会写了、、、

除了操作的困难，本作还一定程度上融入了点解密的元素，每幅图都有数个需要拯救的人，大部分人都需要进行一定的解密操作后才能拯救，拯救人能给你开启更多的游戏内容。初期很简单，不过后期难度系数成梯度上升，颇有些措不及防。

总而言之，玩本作的大致分为两个档次，大触级别的玩家能够完全体会到本作优秀的跑酷爽快感，可以秀的飞起；而初级玩家手残党，如果不在意跑酷模式的话，大部分地方多试几次也可以慢悠悠的通关，解密要素及游戏核心玩法也充分展现了本作的魅力。喜欢2D平面类的玩家不妨试试本作。

33380586.review:
platform的关卡设计大概有两种：

一种角色移动基本没有惯性，跳起来松手立刻下降，这种platform设计起来往往要求玩家在一个较短时间内多次快速精确按键，所以绝对不会在操作上给玩家找麻烦，力图让玩家用最精确的操作通过最困难的陷阱获得最大的成就感。

另一种角色移动惯性嗷嗷大，速度加到最高速度以后跑的飞快，操作尽可能的模糊和直觉化。这种platform设计起来一般不会让玩家在短时间内大量精确操作，而是像跑酷游戏一样在较长时间中切换几种按键组合。
只要设计师强力并且和玩家相互理解，那么玩家只要几个简单的操作就可以完成一个看起来非常困难的关卡，角色行动的流畅感和速度感就会给玩家带来极大的爽快感。但是如果设计师脑子抽了，只要把一个平台摆歪一点，那么看起来特别简单的平台也会坑死玩家两三次而且完美的打断玩家的流畅体验。

我的意思是，splasher属于后者，并且关卡设计师非常出色。
有点像雷曼，如果你喜欢雷曼大概也会喜欢这个作品。
（btw，这个游戏虽然加速较慢但是急停很快，赞）

32538223.review:
警告：在玩本游戏之前，请先做好心态爆炸的准备与觉悟。我们并不推荐你使用原装XBOX ONE或者PS4手柄进行游戏，因为心态爆炸是不可避免的，届时请控制好你的麒麟臂，慎防因失控暴走而摔手柄或砸键盘。

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

平心而论，这是一款相当不错的跑酷游戏，手感流畅，节奏紧凑，动感十足，玩起来十分爽快。画面和配乐也很赞，从游戏素质上说是绝对值这个价的。

但是，这游戏的难度颇、很、非常而且极其地高。面对各种折磨人的机关，你不仅要熟记三把喷枪的对应按键，还要把握好跳跃和滞空的时机、距离等等，非常考验操作。尤其是结尾几个关卡的容错性相当低，别说失误，就是一下子的犹豫也会GG。而且方向键既要控制移动也要控制喷枪的瞄准，简直反人类。我已经数不清在最后一关里重复自虐了多少遍，当时心态已爆炸进入了狂暴状态，要不是最后总算通关了，我绝对会狠狠地[spoiler]摔坏手柄然后[/spoiler]给这游戏打上差评。

所以容我再提醒一次，切记，要控制自己的麒麟臂发作。

话说到底从什么时候起，几乎所有的横版过关游戏都以折磨手残玩家而存在了？

７。感覺好像在玩不用踩怪物的瑪莉歐
８。音樂真是搭配得很好
９。隨著噴槍變多，若操作ＯＫ，可決定讓機器牛是剎車不及摔死，還是控制圓鋸鋸死，甚至讓他彈去廢水池！多種過關法


[h1]分享：[/h1]
１。遊戲有解救同伴要素，其一是小關卡，其二是累積７００油量表解救同伴。所以在進行關卡時，別衝太快而遺漏了油風車和地板的油，會造成不滿７００


[u][h1][b]以下為各關卡簡單解析：[/b][/h1][/u]
１。第１至３關黏性油漆較簡單，屬於教學關卡，要先熟悉跳躍的滑動距離，好拿捏之後跳躍力道
[h1]（頭目關卡完～拿到水槍）[/h1]

２。第４關彈跳油漆關卡，要注意區域內的油全探索再去踩前面道路的彈跳油漆，有部分的道路彈跳完，要往回跳非常困難

３。第５關的水柱關卡，部分水柱要直接從底部低跳衝過去，因為被水柱往上沖會去撞障礙物死亡

４。第６關上升廢水關卡，有黏性和彈性油漆及水柱的綜合，加上上升的廢水，這關唯一重點～別遲疑一路跑酷就對了！一遲疑慢了就是死
[h1]（頭目關卡完～拿到黏性油漆槍）[/h1]

５。第７關機器牛關，主要要讓玩家熟悉水槍和黏漆槍的混用！部分牆面跳躍建議先噴一發黏槍起步

６。第８關雷射關，這關有許多射擊雷射／旋轉雷射／移動雷射／移動交叉雷射／追趕雷射，都有固定模式。射擊雷射要觀察射擊間距～抓正確的時機跳躍。旋轉雷射要注意站立的安全區！移動雷射也是觀察移動間格跳躍！移動交叉雷射則是兩種綜合，要注意跳躍的時機，還要注意交叉間的安全位置。[h1]最後的追趕雷射出現在關卡後半段，會於進入小區域內開始有雷射從後面追趕，除了要快速外，還得交叉使用水槍打怪和用黏槍攀牆，得累積經驗過關[/h1]

７。第九關水槍機關，這關除了水柱外又增加水槍機，水槍機會將玩家的黏膠洗掉，不過難度不高，可以用圓鋸擊殺或先用黏膠黏住他，快通過後，再用水槍洗掉並破壞他，記得一定要破壞，因為水槍機破壞完有油可收集。本關最大的難度是要掌控水柱沖力，因為部分拯救夥伴任務，夥伴位置在很刁鑽的地方，直接被水柱沖到頂端是到不了的，得在水柱沖一半的位置跳躍。[h1]有的拯救任務還得經過三個水柱，但是夥伴卻是在第三個水柱的底部，此部分得第一個水柱往他最底部跳，然後被沖到第二個水柱中間，再往第三個水柱跳，第三個水柱快到頂的時候，往前 "空跳" 掉落，快到底時，按後退進第三個水柱底部，再沖高一點然後按前，跳到牆面拯救夥伴。此部分得重複熟悉[/h1]

８。第１０關彈漆強化關，這關很單純，就是增加了彈漆的難度。例如要在各個牆面彈跳外，還得剛好越過圓鋸，越過圓鋸之外，有的還得在空中用水槍射怪物，才會出現站立平台 (水槍還不能射到牆面的彈漆，不然會摔進廢水池)。[h1]其實，若遊戲中連續彈跳沒這樣飄浮，應該難度會低很多，但是這遊戲天殺的就是彈跳很飄浮，讓你在空中搖桿左右晃，去平衡落點.......[/h1]

９。第１１關風力關，這關會持續有強風往前吹，難度算簡單，要善用黏槍當剎車，用水槍解放機器牛及拯救夥伴，另外～站黏性表面及一般表面和彈性表面，被風吹跳躍的距離是不同的，依次是黏性＞一般＞彈性，要稍微注意距離！本關最大的難度在最後面的連續彈性表面，會被風一直往前帶著快速彈跳，但天花板牆面有一大片油要用水槍收集，然後過關前，還有一隻機器牛黏在天花板，得利用風吹及彈力，跳起用水槍射下機器牛，跳躍及水槍控制頗困難，尤其油的收集～基本上若沒有收集到那一片的一半以上並成功射下機器牛，難以達到７００。

31792682.review:
"It's like Meat Boy combined with the parts in Portal (2) where you're spraying out different shit to get around." -- GrandPooBear

This game is very fun. It's definitely worth the $12 if you're into platforming.  I would recommend it to anyone who likes a fluid 2D platformer like Super Meat Boy, Ori an the Blind Forest, and etc (although Splasher isn't nearly as hard as some of those).  The motion feels natural, the level design is good, and everything flows very well.  You can see the basics in the video; I won't go into that stuff.

My biggest problem with the game is that they made poor choices with the controls (on a controller) in my opinion.  First, "move" and "aim" are both done with the left control stick.  I don't know if there's a better solution, but it's uncomfortable.  Sometimes you want to be able to aim at the ground while you run forward or drift to the left while shooting to the right.  Most annoyingly, sometimes you want to stand still while you aim your shot.  I found it a bit frustrating.  (However, this mechanic does add a lot of interesting optimizations into a speedrun.)

Second, there are three projectiles you can shoot and you can only shoot one of them at a time so those three things are mapped to X, Y, and B.  That much makes sense (conveniently, the colors of those buttons match the color of the corresponding projectile).  The problem is that jump is mapped to A (like basically every platformer ever) so that your right thumb is responsible for both jumping and shooting which makes it hard to do both at the same time.  Toward the end of the game you often find yourself switching quickly between the three projectiles and jumping often which further compounds the difficulty.  For me, this is actually a big problem.

Incidentally, I own the steam controller and I hardly ever use it but it does a great job of mitigating these things.  I remapped the projectiles to the two triggers and right bumper so that my right thumb only jumps and it works great.  Also, it takes some adjustment but the fake d-pad/trackpad on the left thumb of the steam controller works pretty well in place of the left control stick.

The speedrunning modes are a lot of fun.  There are three of them and they're a really interesting way to lengthen a game that might have been short on content otherwise.  I've already spent a lot of time pushing my way through the selfish speedrun mode (my personal favorite) even though I'm terrible at it.  It should be mentioned, though, that the in-game speedrunning modes are casual and will likely never be made official.  For some inexplicable reason the timer stops when you pause the game which means that official categories will likely use real time (although I'm not an expert).

Overall this is a really fun game.  It's a well-made platformer with an interesting gimmick.  Also, I only bought the game because I saw GrandPooBear playing it on twitch, which he commanded me to mention in my review.  :)

31681158.review:
I've only cleared the first 10 levels but make no mistake: It only took one level to realise this game was really well made.
If you're a fan of Super Meat Boy, N++, Dustforce and hell, even Super Mario World in some aspects you'll really love this (Especially if you're into speed running, going FAST and Kaizo stuff).
The uniquity of Splasher though?
There's 3 types of liquids primarily (I've seen thus far) which are Sticky, Bouncy and Water.
Red gel makes you stick to surfaces, yellow gel makes you bounce and water cleans it all off. For that optimal time in a time attack mode, you need to know what gel needs to go where. Red gel on the floor slows you down but on walls and celings lets you move at full speed, so always make sure you spray down with water when there's some floor sections to have to traverse.
Later on the game straight up gives you the bouncy and sticky gels to spray the floors yourself which ramps the difficulty up as you start relying less on reading the stage ahead of you and more on reactions, memorising stages and doing it fast, clean and stylishly. 
There's also 7 people to rescue in each stage treated as 'collectible' you have to grab to unlock more stages. 

The ability to switch between just the standard gameplay of playing the levels, complete with multiple checkpoints and the time attack and Selfish Speedrunner modes gives EVERYONE a good experience. Not very good at doing things personally? Can't memorise stages well? No worries just play the regular levels - it's still worth teh price tag. But for those who want that extra challenge, you've got the modes to test you.

The soundtrack is great too, nothing MIND BLOWING but definitely found myself appreciating it and every jamming along at times (Notably: The first 'auto-scroller' stage, with green goop rising). Especially when you keep dying and starting from a checkpoint and the music kicks in like as if to say "BACK TO IT SCRUB".
Visually, it's got cutesy, cartoon character and visuals a la Castle Crashers or any flash style/Behemoth game though I'm not saying that's necessarily a bad or negative thing. The style works well with the whole aethsetic and the goopy bright gels compliment this.

I'm really looking forward to playing the rest of this wonderfully sculpted game and overall, this is the kind of game that has a LOT of life in it. To grabbing all the dudes in the stage, to getting the gold in time attack to completing the extra speed runnign mdoea and then even trying to get that top time on the leaderboards.
Splasher is the first platformer in a long while I've truly just been impressed and entertained without any discrepencies. If I fucked up - it was on me. The game is solid and the Splashteam guys should be proud of what they've made.

Also Shout out to GrandPOOBear for introducing me to this game.

30502714.review:
Watch the review [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLgrLWsf7Fw]here [/url]

Title: Splasher
Platform: Windows, Mac
Rating: Not Rated
Developer: Splashteam
Publisher: The Sidekicks, Plug In Digital
Price: $15 USD
Release Date: 7th Feb 2017

Splasher is a fun and creative platformer with a hilarious style and top-notch music. And even though the actual speedrun aspect of this game can be questioned as it locks its ‘time attack’ game mode behind items that only hardcore fans will be inclined to get, this game is still a gem in an oversaturated genre and is a must have to any platformer fans, definitely for its low price tag.

You play as a ‘Splasher’: a character that can do what any other character in a platformer does: run and jump. But this character has something a little different; an ink gun that can shoot water to hit switches and kill enemies, red ink that sticks him to walls and ceilings and yellow ink that makes him bounce high and reach otherwise impossible heights.

The core gameplay of Splasher has you traversing through the 22 levels of getting through dangerous environments, saving the innocent co workers at Inkorp and destroying robotic enemies. Through these levels you’ll come across creative ways that the game spices up usual platforming such as lasers that kill you, rotating death traps, being chased by acid and a handful of well designed robots that will try and kill you in stylish ways. And all these tropes never feel overused so that nothing ever feels repetitive and you only feel that you have really done and seen everything only at the end when all the different level designs come together in one amazing final level. 

Other things that change up the platforming is the light on your feet puzzles to save the Inkorp workers, portals that will send you into an arena fighting robots and the time attack game mode that gets you to reach the end of the level in the fastest time. But to get this time attack game mode you have to rescue all the workers and get all the special golden ink that you can extract from walls and ceilings with your water gun for each level respectively. But I feel like it’s unnecessarily locked behind these collectibles just to increase the lifespan of the game as any hardcore platformer player could get through these levels easy and having to get these workers and golden ink just feels more tedious than actually difficult.

But the gameplay is still really fun and enjoyable. And when you do hit all the right buttons and fly through the level, it feels more fluid and amazing than any other platformer I’ve played in the recent years. This is mainly because of the always tight controls and solid level design.

The artstyle of Splasher is a hit and miss at times. Sure, it’s a colourful game and it suits well to the tight on the edge-of-your-seat platforming but when you stop to look you’ll realise that there is barely any detail and feels overly minimalistic. Although this is a small concern as you’ll never stop moving in Splasher, and you won’t want to as the level design is so great.

The music though, is incredible. The techno synth heavy music never gets old and always aided in the gameplay and helped me push forward through some tougher bits. The sound design is just as good with you being able to hear the differences in each surface your character walks on and the sound of liquids hitting objects or enemies dying. You can tell just how much detail has gone in the sound design in immersing you into the wild and fast-paced levels of Inkorp.

The only story you get is less of a cutscene and more of a string of pictures telling you how the boss at Inkorp has kidnapped their workers and are doing crazy scientific experiments on them. You as a ‘Splasher’ has found out, and armed with the trusty gun you have stolen you aim to reach to the top of inkorp and defeat the boss. And this is less of a story and more of an introduction of what you’ll see at Inkorp because this game is very funny in its style and ambience and you’ll find out quickly that this game doesn’t take itself seriously in the way that you die and interact with the enemies.

In conclusion, you can sum up Splasher with one word: fun. Even though its speed run mode is locked behind tedium, it still doesn’t take away from the core gameplay, spectacular level design, detailed music, sound and a light-hearted ambience.

That’s why i’m giving Splasher, a 4/5.

30459482.review:
Splasher manages to mix in the goo elements from Portal 2 and the flow of Super Meat Boy into a fun platformer. The different inks are introduced steadily throughout the game and each level manages to introduce a new mechanic/concept to keep the game experience feeling fresh. While it's a relatively short game, having around 22 levels, there are still quite a few extras for the game such as a time trial mode and a speedrun mode to complete the whole game in a given time frame.

One thing that I did find kind of annoying is getting the timing right on getting certain inks aimed at a particular direction. The way you aim your inks is through the same directional pad as your movement, which works well in game. However, there have been plenty of times where I've messed up a jump, because I didn't aim at the right spot and the right time. A suggestion I have would be to make the LT/L2 and RT/R2 buttons be made for aiming straight for a particular direction like up or down.

That said, if you like precision based platformers, I'd gladly recommend Splasher. It's a fun game that makes good use of its ink mechanics and gives players a fun series of challenges throughout its level design.

30350699.review:
In Splasher, you play as a nimble hazmat agent who rushes through levels packed full of enemies and environmental hazards, rescuing fellow team members on the race to defeat a cigar-chomping scientist and his army of mutant potatoes.  Aiding you are a handful of brightly-colored liquids:  Water to wash surfaces clean (and blast most enemies), sticky goo to help you climb surfaces like a spider, and bouncy goo to propel you through the air like a lunatic.  It's all very vibrant and charming.  In this sense, the comparisons to Super Meat Boy and Splatoon are unsurprising.  

Challenge-wise, however, Splasher never really approaches the balls-hard difficulty of Super Meat Boy.  There are certainly situations where the average player may die 5 or 6 times attempting to navigate an area, but it doesn't remotely approach Super Meat Boy on the whole.  That may disappoint players who have been sold on the idea that Splasher will scratch the same itch that Super Meat Boy does; there's simply no comparison when it comes to difficulty.

Similarly, at 22 levels, Splasher's packaged with a much smaller selection of levels than Super Meat Boy's 300+.  That isn't to say that Splasher's an especially short game, or that it's lacking material--on the contrary, between the "normal" game and the various speedrun modes/medals to earn, there's a decent amount of replayability to the game.  But again, it may disappoint players who expect for Splasher to boast multiple worlds, hidden levels, and various other secrets.

That being said, will you enjoy Splasher?   If you like games such as Dust Force and Super Meat Boy for their mix of platforming, speed, and relative challenge, you'll most likely enjoy Splasher.  If you like leaderboards and discovering ways to shave seconds off of your PR times, you'll probably like Splasher.  But if you're looking for a game that's so hard it'll give you a nose bleed, you'll probably feel let down.  


PROS:  
+ A clean aesthetic that is generally very readable, which makes it perfect for speedrunning.
+ Overall, the "feel" of the controls and the way the player handles is well done.
+ Between the normal game, individual medal runs, and 3 different flavors of speedrun, there's plenty of replayability.

CONS:
- On a gamepad, the controls for movement and aiming are tied to the same analog stick, which can result in a lot of sloppy aiming and/or accidental movement; while this stems from compromises in the control scheme, it's still an incredibly frustrating problem that you will likely encounter at the worst (and most frantic) moments, such as rushing headlong into a trap while trying to aim at a critical target during a speedrun.  
- A very minor con, but for a game that emphasizes speedrunning so much, it's annoying to have to sit through various animations and cutscenes every time you attempt a run.  These don't count towards your overall time, and should be confined to the "normal" game.
- The level-select hub is a chaotic sprawl that doesn't improve the overall experience, and essentially makes choosing (or simply finding) specific levels more work than it should be.  

OTHER NOTES: 
* Not a huge fan of the art style--the general flatness and large spans of solid color remind me too much of a free flash game, which cheapens the experience for me.  There are little touches that stand out, such as the bublous green mutations that give a sense of transparency and depth, but they almost feel out of place next to everything else.

30341105.review:
[b]Splasher[/b] - креативный и забавный 2D платформер от разработчиков Splashteam. Экшен, в стремительно ускоряющемся темпе, заставит твои пальцы дымиться не дожидаясь близкого знакомства.

Сплешер - обыкновенный работник лакокрасочного завода. В один из рабочих дней, любопытство преподнесло ему неприятный сюрприз, и жизнь кардинально переменилась. Заглянув в приоткрытые двери Сплешер увидел то, чего видеть не следовало: его босс Docteur ставил эксперименты и тем самым губил невинных работников Inkorp. К несчастью он был замечен, и надо бы поскорее уносить ноги, но как же другие сотрудники, ведь им уготовлена та же участь? Главный герой принимает решения остаться, пока не спасет всех от злодея. Удастся ли ему успеть и завершить свою миссию? На пути сотни противников и тысячи препятствий, а время поджимает..

Все уровни представлены в "Inkorp Hall" - зал с постепенно открывающимися дверьми-уровнями, а каждый из них - это часть локации гигантского завода. Как тому и положено, по мере прохождения, сложность набирает обороты. В вашем инвентаре появляются разновидности красок (клейкая, отталкивающая), которые помогают вам преодолеть локацию, спасти сотрудников и собрать 700 баллов для освобождения последнего. Врагов становиться больше как количеством, так и разновидностью (кого-то можно уничтожить водой (как я понял, голубая жидкость - это вода, но возможно какая-то краска), а вот некоторых только хитростью). Локации становятся изощреннее, требуют быстрой реакции и моментальных решений, без каких-либо колебаний. Не знаю, как остальным игрокам, а лично мне пришлось напрягаться уже уровня с 5-го (где-то около этого уровня, вас, помимо всех прочих сложностей, начинает сносить с локации, и тут-то и начинается треш!). И вот, когда вы уже в курсе всех препятствий, можете перейти (на самый сложный, по моему мнению) уровень "Time Attack", где вам предлагается пройти 22 уровня на время, и занести свой результат в общую таблицу среди остальных игроков. Попробовать себя на скорость появляется возможность, как только открывается "Inkorp Hall", но я не советую туда соваться не пройдя основные сюжетные уровни.

Яркая и приятная мультяшная графика не позволяет сравнивать данный продукт со старыми играми на приставке. Музыкальное сопровождение энергичное и ненавязчивое, прекрасно дополняет динамику игры.
Единственное, что огорчило, это то, что игра не поддерживала мой контроллер, на клавиатуре управление достаточно осложнено.

30087836.review:
Platforming games are perhaps the most common genre out there, even before the rise of Steam and being able to grab a bunch of them for less than twenty bucks on a sale. But they’re also perhaps the hardest to do well. There’s really no getting around making the gameplay of one good, and failing to do that is practically a kiss of death. While Splasher doesn’t reinvent the wheel, it does provide a very enjoyable experience.

The story takes place in a massive paint factory, Inkorp, whose owner has suddenly revealed himself as a mad scientist, kidnapping workers and experimenting on them, as well as using an army of killer robots to do the task. You know, as you do. As the only unique-looking worker in the bunch you have to put a stop to that using a gun that can fire water, and later on a few different kinds of paint. Red lets you walk up walls and on the ceiling, while yellow bounces you around. 

Your water gun is used to flip switches and defeat enemies, although aside from some moments where you’re locked in combat is a bit of an afterthought, thanks to some liberal auto-aim on the game’s part. That isn’t to say enemies aren’t dangerous though, as even the ones not trying to kill you directly can still cause your death by washing away the paint you’re using to get around. Thus far they’re placed fairly, to make the levels harder but still doable.

In each level of the game you’ll find seven workers in peril that you can rescue that spell out Splash! Six are strewn about the level behind some tough jumps or puzzle rooms, and the final one is at the end, locked in a cage you’ll need to have enough energy from the stage to unlock. You get that by destroying enemies and washing off special glowing patches of paint. 

This set-up reminded me a lot of Donkey Kong, particularly the newer games by Retro, as well as the newer Rayman titles. The latter thought turned out to be quite appropriate, as three of the game’s staff are Romaine Claude, Richard Vatinel and Aymeric Schwartz, the level designer, art director, and composer for Origins respectively. I can safely say all their talent is not wasted on the game.

Each level I’ve played - about six of the twenty-two the game seems to have - has been well-crafted, and built around speed. Apparently Splashy was made through a collaboration with speedrunners, and I can see why. If everything lined up perfectly, you’d be able to get through levels quite fast.

The levels themselves are also a treat to look at as well as play. Factory levels in games tend to be really dingy, dark places, but owing to it manufacturing paint the one in Splasher is very colorful and almost feels alive. Water spouts up from pipes to propel you upward, turrets paint the walls and ceiling automatically - even things that kill you are very comfortable. You die in one hit, but so far I haven’t felt any real frustration. The music is also very nice, being jazzy and upbeat.

About the only knock I can think of to the game is that it’s one of those games that takes it for granted you’re playing with a controller. All the prompts are for one, and you can’t change keyboard controls, which are WADS for movement and IJKL for shooting water and paint. Obviously not everyone plays games like this on a keyboard and that’s fine, but it is something to be aware of. I’d say it’s perfectly playable on keyboard, though, aside from jumping over saws while wall-running, which I found a bit awkward.

Another thing that might be a flaw is that advancing through levels is gated off by you rescuing the workers in levels, so it’s not entirely an optional goal. So far it’s not too strict, but if you’d just prefer to blaze through levels it could be a flaw. Some of them did take me a few tries to rescue.

Overall, if you’re looking for a well-done, if not exactly an innovative platformer, or a new game to speedrun, I think Splasher would do nicely despite these minor flaws.

This review was done on behalf of Save Or Quit (saveorquit.com). It didn't affect my views on the game.

非常优秀的横版动作游戏，一共22关，操作和解谜比重为90%-10%。
关卡设计出色，专门为跑酷速通设计，最快只要几十分钟就能通关，还有逃生关特别强调速通和操作流畅。正常通关时间是8小时左右，全收集时间更长。每关可以解救工人，组成SPLASH！7个字符，第7个人需要700分才能解救。
游戏核心玩法是3种喷剂，水，粘性喷漆和跳跃喷漆，这在Nihilumbra已经有类似设计了，不过本游戏更强调流畅地躲避机关而不是解谜，3种喷剂随关卡逐步解锁交给玩家控制，后期需要快速切换，一旦弄错就很容易死。
每关都有一个主题，包括水柱，弹跳，激光，毒水，大风等，而且同样主题不会连续出现，可以保持新鲜感。
解救工人需要操作更加快速和准确，每关还有可选的隔离区，要求消灭怪物通过，有些隔离区偏解谜。
游戏的移动有惯性，这是比较有争议的，大部分平台动作游戏都没有，是为了精准控制。有惯性的话速通很流畅，但微调就比较难，游戏强调速通所以没什么问题。可惜的是倒数第3关最后设计就有问题了，平台非常小而且有各种延时激光，对精准要求非常高，结果我为了救人死了几十次才过，然后分数居然是698差两分，不过我都不想重打了。
另外游戏操作最大的问题是不能原地瞄准，导致打非直线目标非常容易掉下平台。

总评8.5/10

On passera sur le côté visuel que je trouve correct sans être ouf, mais on sent que le gameplay avait l'intérêt principal des développeurs.

29957679.review:
I think I can pretty definitively say at this point that this is one of my favorite platformers of all time, and I've only really scratched the surface of it. 

To start off: This game is very, VERY meticulously designed for speedrunning. The game's controls and level design are fluid and fast. Levels are designed in a way that rewards quick movement; lots of cycle-based stuff that you can make and just looks awesome when you do, but only if you're fast enough. Pretty dang tight platinum medal times to beat in single-level time-attack. Built-in full game speedruns for three different categories. An integrated split system that lets you easily track just how far ahead or behind you are of your best runs. The only things really missing are time attack ghosts and a quick restart (the latter of which is intended to be added soon and feels very sorely needed). As well there are a small number of short unskippable cutscenes but those are pretty minor. 

The game is pretty dang great to play casually, too; a smooth progression of gameplay mechanics and difficulty across 22 levels, with the first few levels getting you used to the basic mechanics, then giving you the stick ink and bounce ink at about a quarter and 2/3rds of the way into the game. The levels tend to be focused on one core mechanic but still incorporate some of the other mechanics to keep levels diverse and interesting. And the last level ties everything together and adds a simple boss fight to boot. There's 7 splashers to rescue in each level, the last of which requiring you to collect 700 yellow ink, which tends to require nearly every speck of the level to be scoured, but never feels too hard to get (I never actually had to replay a level to get the 700 ink myself).

Visually the game is also pretty gorgeous, a nice cartoony style with lots of vibrant colors. The level design itself is fairly blocky but it works well with how movement in the game works. And the control scheme makes quite a bit of sense (if you use controller, at least; I found it near unplayable on keyboard and I wouldn't recommend it regardless given how important aiming with the D-pad is). The soundtrack I'm pretty indifferent on, it's solid enough & doesn't annoy me, and it fits the mood of the game well enough. The plot's very simple and conveyed entirely without dialogue but it's basically an excuse plot to get the whole thing rolling and I'm totally fine with that.

You can definitely tell this game was made by a designer for the Rayman Origins/Legends games, up to using both those games as level titles (alongside quite a number of pop culture references). The atmosphere is pretty similar (though not as wacky), the level design is absolutely up to par with the Rayman games (heck, might even be better), it's just a great experience all around. The kind of game I am very seriously considering getting into speedrunning the full game for (though I haven't gotten there yet; soon, though, once I at least gold medal all the levels in time attack).

It's got minimal frustrations, clever and varied level design, a great length to not feel too short but keep the whole game plenty replayable, a lot of obvious fine-tuning to make it as player friendly as possible while still providing a decent challenge... absolutely worth checking out for any fans of 2D platformers.

Splasher est un jeu exigeant à la difficulté agréable mais très maîtrisable grâce à un apprentissage naturel en jeu. La vingtaine de niveaux se renouvelle régulièrement avec de nombreux éléments s'ajoutant et se combinant, tout comme les capacités du héros permettant d'appréhender différemment les environnements. Si parcourir Splasher de manière standard offrira trois ou quatre heures de jeu, c'est surtout par ses modes orientés speedruns qu'il prendra de la durée de vie et tiendra la longueur pour notre plus grand plaisir.

29903548.review:
Je vais fait simple : Splasher est une réussite absolue !

Graphiquement son look cartoon est un régal pour les yeux et renforce le côté amusant de mettre de la peinture partout.

Les musiques sont très sympas et accompagnent parfaitement l’action, n’hésitant pas à s’emballer dans les moments stressants, notamment les phases où vous devrez échapper à un bain d’acide.

Pour la jouabilité c’est du tout bon également, avec un personnage qui répond parfaitement aux commandes et la possibilité de tirer de la peinture collante / rebondissante donne un excellent sentiment de liberté quant aux chemins à emprunter.

Les niveaux sont variés et on sent le soin apporté à leur création pour qu’ils ajoutent tous quelque chose de nouveau.

La bonne humeur générale est également renforcée par le nom des niveaux et des succès qui sont tous des jeux de mots bien sentis, même vous faire écraser par une porte devrait vous faire rire.

Pour être franc je ne vois rien à redire sur Splasher, c’est donc sans aucune hésitation qu’il obtient une sélection GSS et que j’incite tout joueur à l’essayer, vous ne le regretterez pas (et ne prenez pas peur devant le trailer, les nombreux points de passage font que le jeu n’est pas aussi difficile qu’il n’y parait).

Lire le test complet sur [url=http://www.gamesidestory.com/2017/02/13/splasher/]Game Side Story[/url]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SktZr_bjexA

29859737.review:
En voila un bon petit plateformer !

Imaginez L'enfant de Rayman Origins, Portal 2 et Oddworld le tout a la sauce Super Meat Boy et vous obtenez EXACTEMENT Splasher !

Ce que vous allez lire ci-dessous pourrait s'apparenter a un acharnement a chercher la petite bete... Mais sachez que si je chipotte autant c'est parceque j'ai ADORE ce jeu et vais surement passer de nombreuses heures a le speedruner !

Gameplay: 
Au premier abord il est tres propre. Notre avatar glisse legerement mais on s'y fait vite. Cependant on en viens vite a rager apres la visee. En effet quand la difficultee ce corse et que les combinaisons entre les jets et les timmings deviennent plus serre, il est parfois difficile de tirer sous ses pieds. De meme, il vous sera impossible de tirer en restant immobile (ou alors je n'ai pas trouve comment) et cela vous jouera parfois des tours.

Level Design: 
Le jeu a clairement ete concu pour le speerun. On regretera le manque d'embranchements et de choix de route dans les niveaux. Les timmings sont clairement definis par des triggers a des points precis (souvent au checkpoints) et on comprend tres vite que l'on peu en abuser . Pas vraiment de surprises dans leurs rythme et souvent (9 fois sur 10) courir le plus vite possible des le respawn et le moyen le plus facile de passer releguant du coup le skill et l'adaptivitee au second rang. Un petit detail qui m'a surpris, impossible de mourir sur les scies fixe au mur. En effet vous serez bloque avant par une barriere invisible et le seul moyen de mourir dessus sera de sauter directement dedans... Choix etrange.

Ha... Et ce lobby pour passer de level en level... Merci, mais non merci ^^'

Sound Design:
L'environnement sonnore est clair et les sons bien definis. Une fois habitue, on sait ce qui ce passe les yeux ferme ! Par contre... La musique qui redemarre a chaque respawn est pour moi une grosse erreure et on en viens vite a la detester malgres les compos plutot sympa... Gros dommage !

Difficultee:
(N'ayant pas encore teste le mode time-attack, cette critique porte sur le mode Standard du jeu.)
Etant habitue a speedrunner de Super Meat Boy (PB 23"45'), J'avais entendu dire que Splasher etait bien plus dur/complex a prendre en main. Pour ma part, J'ai seulement accumule les try a partir du Niveau 19 sur les 22 que compte le jeu. Ceci dit, la difficultee semble relativement bien repartie tout au long du jeu et suivant le shema suivant: 

1) Un niveau assez simple vous presente de nouveaux mobs/pieges/mechaniques, 
2) Les niveaux suivant exploitent ces nouvelles difficultees en les combinants
3) un gros niveau que l'on pourrait qualifier de "niveau boss" vous chalengera

C'est assez banal me direz-vous... Et vous aurez raison! Mais dans le cas de Splasher la courbe de difficulte est vraiment tres definie et les paliers/piques de difficulte ce font bien resentir. Et ca c'est plutot cool et gratifiant pour les joueurs les moins experimentes !

J'espere que les temps du mode time-attack seront quand a eux calcule au poil des les premiers niveaux afin d'offrir un challenge un peu plus releve au joueurs experimentes)

Features:
Les dev's de Splasher ont bosse avec avec une belle brochette de speedrunner lie au NES.Blog.. Et ca ce sent ! Chrono IG, leaderboard, Differentes categories directement dans le jeu (100%, any%, time attack...) On est au top pour le speedrun et pour defier ses amis ! Si je peux me permettre une suggestion... Une galerie pour les replays et un mod ghost seraient la cerise sur le gateau !

Sinon le jeu entier baigne dans les references au cinema et aux autres jeu et c'est toujours un plaisir de decouvrir ses clins d'oeil !

Bref... Pour que je poste un pave tel que celui-ci dans les critiques de steam... C'est que le jeu vaut vraiment le coup !


TL:DR 
Splasher soutient aisement la comparaison avec son concurent direct: Super Meat Boy
Si vous avez ponce SMB en long en large et en travers ou si vous souhaitez changer un peu d'air, Splasher et fait pour vous malgres quelques petit defauts de gameplay et sa difficulte un peu en deca.
Vous n'avez pas joue a Super Meat Boy ? Splasher est egalement fait pour vous avec sa courbe de difficultee intelligement repartie !


NB: J'ai eu la chance de gagner une clee. Cependant vu la qualitee de travail fourni, je pense racheter le jeu des que mes finances me le permetrons !

29859090.review:
Ayant grandement apprécié SMB à l'époque, et les jeux de plateforme, étant un style que j'aime je me suis interresé à celui-ci.
Dans l'ensemble c'est un bon jeu, pas excellent mais bon. Un bonne diversité dans les niveaux et l'ajout progressif de nouvelles mécaniques arrivent à nous tenir en haleine, et quand on arrive à enchaîner plusieurs saut sans marquer d'arrêt, on se sent fier.
Cependant, le gros point noir de ce jeu est le système de lock ultra capricieux, de plus j'ai l'impression (peut-être que ce n'est que moi) que les diagonales sont mal "calibrées". Ce qui est vraiment handicapant car le jeu repose sur ce système.
Pour ma part après presque 7h de jeu et le dernier niveau atteint, je ne pense pas y passer plus de temps, et comme les avis sur Steam fonctionnent de manière binaire, je suis obligé de déconseiller le jeu.

29802882.review: 玩了差不多90分钟，砸到第6关，难度适中（鬼畜）。蜜汁bgm，惯性坑爹，这些元素结合起来成就了这款游戏。而且就算你通关了也不会有任何厌烦之心。因为还有22个时间竞赛关卡等着你去玩，去挑战。可以安利给好基友玩玩。手残例外。（我会告诉你我第一关的时间竞赛挤进前150了嘛）

29800977.review:
这是款半硬核冒险游戏。制作者全是dalao级别的，《雷曼传奇》的关卡设计师，《勇敢的心》的音效师，游戏质量自然差不了。新颖的体验方式，同时更加考验手脑结合，考验玩家在对应情况下喷射对应的喷漆，硬核跳刺技巧也是发挥的淋漓尽致，难度适合大众玩家。

[h1]剧情梗概[/h1]

这是一个喷漆公司，这是一个生产不同寻常喷漆的公司。主要生产两种漆，红色喷漆的附着力很强，能让人像壁虎一样在上面爬，甚至粘在屋顶；黄色喷漆如同光圈科技的“弹跳凝胶”一样，在上面弹来弹去根本停不下来....我们的主角只是个普通的工人，与大家一样忙忙碌碌与车间，穿着一样的工作制服，唯一异于其他人的，就是那连防毒面具都挡不住的头发，远看就像一片紫色的大叶子。一日，主角在打扫卫生时，无意中发现了公司老板的阴谋：拿工人做生化实验。最可怕的是老板也发现了他的视x，率机器人众追杀过来，情急之下主角启动了喷气机暂时逃离了追杀（为什么主角会有喷气机？）。

随后，在主角进一步逃离追杀时发现，老板研发了一种绿色剧毒喷漆，凡是喷到的人或机器人都会变异并致死，之前视x时看到老板给工友打入身体的就是这种东西。在路途上，拯救了“一裤衩子”的工友，除了主角之外，其他人几乎都被抓住待做生化实验了（[b]叫你们不要跟那个紫头发的人玩嘛[/b]）；获得了自己最熟悉不过的红黄喷漆，用来对付与躲避老板设下的机关陷阱，最后，老板穷尽手段也未能杀掉主角，反倒被主角抓住，破掉其阴谋并带领众人逃出喷漆公司。

[h1]游玩感受[/h1]

剧情让咱想到了天朝的古谚语：天将降大任与是人也，必先苦其心志，劳其筋骨，饿其体肤，空乏其身，行拂乱其所为，所以动心忍性，增益其所不能。。主角只是个工人，在危机关头也会发挥出其英雄的一面，超常发挥，表现出出色的技巧。

诸多动作冒险游戏中，splasher的模式更倾向于雷曼传奇那种，没有血条，多存档点，可收集点数...呃，本来就是雷曼的制作者参与了，咳咳。玩法除了核心的跳刺跳台，还加入了极限操作，例如大风的那一关，救一个粘在墙上的工人，需要一个大跳，急转身喷黄漆将他弹下来，然后在下方的悬空墙面迅速喷红漆并跑至最低点接住弹下来的工人，这一操作需要行云流水，一步失误都会让工人“嗝屁”了。追逐战是我最喜欢的，好比雷曼传奇的音乐关卡，紧张刺激，即便死了也很兴奋的说。

[h1]正式版变动与其优点和不足[/h1]

1.正式版操作人物手感很好，尤其是转身惯性上做了优化，使得人物不再像demo那样鬼畜转弯。
2.瞄准怪物或可收集奖励喷漆时，准星由十字花变成了圈，自动锁定的判定范围未变，无伤大雅。
3.冲撞机器人在demo里是可以用水枪消灭的，正式版改成了必须用齿轮或者毒液消灭，考验操作。
4.demo版可以自定义按键，而正式版不可以在游戏内改键位，除非去游戏配置文件手动设置。另有些小伙伴反映PS4手柄不能完美支持此游戏，望开发者更新自定义键位功能并修复某些控制器的bug。
5.首页没有任何提示，至少加入个“press enter to continue”来提示玩家如何进入游戏界面。
6.这个是个人观点，追逐战时的BGM做了重置，不如demo版的听着带感。
7.有个细节我注意到了，demo里若是弹跳到金属墙面上不会发生什么，但正式版弹上去后会有音调，细节灰常吼。
8.刚发行的游戏，bug自然是有的：在只能跳上的平台喷红漆之后，左右横跳会有几率穿过平台掉下去o.o，待修复。

[h1]总结[/h1]

这个结局给人一种意犹未尽的感觉，工厂被关闭了，工人何去何从？老板又该怎么处置？可能是冒险RPG玩多了，猫某也老是想多了2333...喜欢冒险动作以及跑酷游戏的可以来尝试下这款，紧张刺激贼特喵滴爽。

29798097.review:
[h1] 一款物美价廉的2D横版平台跳跃游戏[/h1]
看了散人的视频就过来买了，结果一上手就停不下来了。简单给大家推荐一下吧。
[olist]
    [*]清洁工拯救世界?新奇的解密元素
        作为[strike]法国某游戏公司[/strike]邪恶蔬菜组织[strike]服务器[/strike]培养土豆的清洁工，你发现这些[strike]服务器[/strike]土豆竟然是用你的同事做的，于是喜闻乐见的大逃杀剧情就开始了，你要一边逃脱一边找到罪魁祸首一边拯救还没变成服务器[strike]土豆[/strike]的同事。在这个过程中，你会找到土豆做成的两种喷漆，一种可以让你变成司柏德man，另一种是弹弹乐，你要熟练运用这两种喷漆来通过各种机关，但是经常会选错喷漆而导致GG。
    [*]良好的操作手感和不太友好的键位
        作为一款2D的横版平台跳跃游戏，跳跃手感自然是重中之重。Splasher里选择的带有惯性的物理引擎，这也导致了我一上来数次思必得太快而落命。键盘采用的是传统的操作，wasd移动，k和空格都可以跳跃，但是J和L是喷漆，这也导致习惯用K键跳跃的玩家经常误操作。[b]强烈推荐大家用手柄游玩，兼容性和操作感都非常好[/b]
    [*]跑酷模式，你们跟得上我的思必得么？
       在正常关卡里没有时间限制，主要是要[strike]收集[/strike]拯救你的同事，并以此来解锁新的关卡。本作同时还提供了跑酷模式，在跑酷模式中你不需要理会收集要素，只要用最短的时间到达终点就可以了[spoiler] 背板狂魔大胜利[/spoiler]。
[/olist]
    总的来说，喜爱横版平台跳跃的玩家一定不要错过本作哦。
    [spoiler]不说了，去玩好哥哥送的仁王了[/spoiler]

Super Meat Boy (DA originale + plateformeur nerveux + gros potentiel speedrun) x Rayman (nombreux checkpoints + lums + electoons) x Portal (gels physiques) x Splatoon (pistolet à peinture) = Must Have.

Après quelques heures, les checkpoints s'écartent un peu plus, et on se retrouve avec quelques phases très trial and error du meilleur effet pour ceux qui accrochent au style !
Et au risque de répéter ce qui a déjà été déjà dit, le jeu est parfaitement pensé pour le speedrun, avec plusieurs modes de speedrun (égoiste, standard, 100%, ou par niveau), et des splits intermédiaires à chaque checkpoint du niveau pour voir l'évolution de notre temps.

29772894.review: 快节奏的敏捷型平台游戏，画风是简洁可爱的卡通，到处喷射的酱汁让人感到喜悦和欢乐。和《雷曼：传奇》等同系列游戏有些相似，但这款游戏在操作上更加需要玩家的灵巧。玩到现在主要是游戏的控制问题，人物移动以及射击方向是同一轴控制的，手柄右侧的方向轴完全是没有用的，所以想定点射击是几乎不可能的。如果能够自定义控制器或者能够用鼠标射击就更好了。推荐大家使用手柄进行游戏。

29772468.review:
I have been playing Splasher since before it was officially released. Starting with the demo, it was an incredible game. Better than most games indie games I have played. Now, the full release is even better than I expected it to be. For sure it is one of the best indie games of recent times. Maybe even one of the best idnie games ever! I just simply can't find the strength to stop playing the full release.

The game is better played with a controller by the way.

Pros:
-Easy to pick up and udnerstand, but challenging at the same time.
-Fluid mechanics (literally too!)
-Even on the first few levels, you will die multiple times. The difficulty scales up as the game progresses, just like your skill!
-The art in the game is awesome!
-Music is insanely contageous.
-Story telling is excellent. Without a word being spoken, you will udnerstand what is going on. Kind of like Teslagrad for those of you who have played it.
-Humor is everywhere! From the way you die, to the way you kill your enemies, the game just makes you laugh.

Cons:
-Only 22 levels.
-No online co-op.

29771664.review:

29770930.review:
YEEEEEESSSSS!  As a huge platformer fan, and specifically a lover of Meatboy (figuratively), this game has me hooked!

Great level design? Check
Smooth jump physics? Check
Varied mechanics? Check
Built in speedrun leaderboards? Check
Other things that I'm probably overlooking but are great? Check

My previous review stated that it was a bit too easy but difficulty definitely ramped up towards the end.  Not masochisitc like Meat Boy or 1001 spikes, but hard enough that it was satisfying to beat.  Speedrunning is where the game shines for replay value, and you will die... a lot... trying to climb the leaderboard.  

A fantastic game that deserves way more press.

29767776.review:
I'm happy with Splasher, surprisingly so.  After playing a few versions of the demo, and now having a full run under my belt of the full release, I can comment on a few things:

[B]Pros:[/b]
-Excellent art and sound design
-Fluid controls, nice and meaty (and appropriately floaty) - they don't take too long to get adjusted to
-Difficulty curve seems to be on point, however a bit on the easy side for the first 10 levels
-Fun sense of humor - love the art design and the comic relief of some of the collectibles
-Gameplay mechanics are very polished, and feel very similiar to Super Meat Boy.  You feel in control - very important.

[B]Cons:[/b]
-Often TOO forgiving - checkpoints are very generous, making it a little too easy to complete the game by default
-Would love to see some multiplayer action for CO-OP, and have them develop a CO-OP based paint system
-Would like to see more than 22 levels

Here's a video review for my full review of it:
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g56kCSkA8cg] Video Review (more indepth)[/url]
